title: Science Engineering and Technology Edition 3
summary: Edition 3 frames science, engineering, and technology as connected pathways. Learners explore how scientific inquiry moves into engineered solutions and technology products.
practicalActivities: Design a classroom demo showing the scientific method feeding an engineered prototype
Map a local problem to a technology solution with user feedback

title: Laboratory and Field Science Careers
summary: Covers careers that collect data, run experiments, and validate findings. Emphasizes documentation, lab safety, instrumentation, and ethics.
practicalActivities: Create a sample lab notebook entry with controls and variables
Plan a field survey with data validation steps

title: Engineering Design Tracks
summary: Shows how engineers move from requirements to prototypes and testing loops. Stresses collaboration, safety factors, and iterative design.
practicalActivities: Rewrite vague requirements into testable specifications
Draft a simple design review checklist

title: Technology and Computing
summary: Highlights careers that turn engineered designs into digital and hardware products. Focus on software practices, networks, and user-centered design.
practicalActivities: Build a small troubleshooting guide for common device issues
Outline a usability test script for a prototype app

title: Sustainable and Emerging Tech
summary: Connects STEM careers to sustainability, renewable energy, and responsible innovation. Encourages life-cycle thinking and community impact.
practicalActivities: Compare the footprint of two materials for the same product
Plan a sensor layout for monitoring a small site

title: Career Readiness and Portfolios
summary: Guides learners to assemble evidence of skills: projects, certifications, reflection, and community work. Encourages informational interviews and mentoring.
practicalActivities: Draft a one-page portfolio that links a project to specific skills
List three mentors and questions for an informational interview
